div.class: vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1565717476890 vc_row-has-fill vc_general vc_parallax vc_parallax-content-moving-fade js-vc_parallax-o-fade
wpb_text_column wpb_content_element wpb_animate_when_almost_visible wpb_fadeIn fadeIn vc_custom_1581015502029

p.strong: It is an honor to serve as the superintendent of such an amazing school district. Libby, Montana is truly a great place to live and work. Libby Public School District, a caring and collaborative learning community, ensures that each student achieves intellectual and personal excellence, and is well prepared for college and career pathways.

We have many remarkable achievements, programs, and other successes to be proud of in our schools. This past spring we obtained certification through the rigorous AdvancED process. Our high school was award the Northwest Energy Academic Excellence Award and our elementary was awarded the Gold Award at the MBI Institute this past summer.

Take a look around and learn more about the special happenings that take place every day in our schools. And please, if you have any questions, please use the Contact page to reach out. We love hearing from our community.

div.class: vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1581014352727 vc_row-has-fill vc_general vc_parallax vc_parallax-content-moving-fade js-vc_parallax-o-fade

div.span:
April 20, 2020 (9:30 a.m.) Families of Libby Prek-12 Schools, We would like to thank the parents for your work and commitment on behalf of your child/children. At the middle/high school, we have gone from 30% work turned in to 76% of our students turning work back to their teachers. Our rate of student engagement at the elementary is similar to the middle/high school. THANK YOU!! Our goal is that 100% of our students will make progress during this time of our expanded learning. As you can see we still have a ways to go. It can be hard as the parent having to take on the struggles of getting school work done at home, but your efforts will make a positive, long-term difference for you child/children. Please reach out to your child’s/children’s teachers if you have questions. If you son or daughter is older, this is a good time to teach them to advocate for themselves. The Governor announced Friday that they will lay out a plan to open the State back up in phases. Opening of a school would be Phase 2. By the time schools are allowed to open, we will have created a plan that will limit the numbers of individuals in the buildings at one time. The only thing we know now about that plan is that we will not have 1200 kids in our buildings at the same time. We still continue to hold out hope that our kids will be back at school, even if it is part-time for a few weeks. We plan to recognize our Seniors on their graduation day of Saturday, May 30. This is our finish line and we will do all that we can to ensure we send the Class of 2020 off into the world with a memorable recognition. As of now, the graduation ceremony plan depends on any restrictions in place at the time. Meals will continue to be served at each building and on the bus routes on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. We have been serving 450+ Grab-n-Go meals each delivery day. Please reach out to your child’s/children’s teacher(s) if you have questions. Sincerely,
Craig Barringer, Superintendent

div.class: vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1565717476890 vc_row-has-fill vc_general vc_parallax vc_parallax-content-moving-fade js-vc_parallax-o-fade

div.h2: LPS Is an AdvancED Accredited School

div.span: Click on the school picture for more information

div.p: Libby is fortunate to be able to offer a free, public preschool program for all 4 year olds in our community.
Libby Elementary instills a love of learning for all students while serving K-6th grades.
LMHS, serving 7-12th grades, leverages effective curriculum strategies to ensure that all students are college and career ready.
LPS takes pride in providing a top-notch, well-rounded educational system that helps students prepare for the world ahead of them.

div.span: Libby Public School District attempts to make its information accessible to all individuals. If you use special adaptive equipment and encounter problems when using this website, please report them using the contact form below, or by contacting the district superintendent office directly. We will work to correct the issue and/or provide the information in an alternate format.

div.p: Libby Public Schools via UserWay makes available an accessibility widget called the UserWay Accessibility Widget that is powered by a dedicated accessibility server. The software allows the site to improve its compliance with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG 2.0). Access the accessibility widget by locating the icon in the corner of the page. Visit userway.org for more information.
